rule: The chatbot can respond with multiple part of speech tags or with tags not included in the predefined list.
input: sentence: 'They set the set on the set', word: 'set'
output:
CC: Subordinating conjunction
CD: Cardinal number (none in this case)
EX: Existential there
DT: Determiner
JJ: Adjective, superlative (the best option, but 'superlative' isn't present), 
JJS: Adjective, comparative (same as 'superlative'), JJR: Adjective, comparative is not available for sets, JJS: Comparative is same as "superlative", 
NN: Noun
PN: Proper noun
complianceText:
The chatbot output includes multiple part-of-speech tags with explanations, whereas the description specifies that only a single part-of-speech tag should be returned.
ERR
